upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 1. He recites the eighty tristichs of Gâyatrîs 2 . Verily, the eighty Gâyatrî tristichs are this world (earth). Whatever there is in this world of glory, greatness, wives, food, and honour, may I obtain it, may I win it, may it be mine.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 2. Next comes the Sûdadohas verse. Sûdadohas verily is breath. He joins this world with breath.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 3. He recites the eighty tristichs of B ri hatîs. Verily, the eighty B ri hatî tristichs are the world of the sky. Whatever there is in the world of the sky of glory, greatness, wives, food, and honour, may I obtain it, may I win it, may it be mine.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 4. Next comes the Sûdadohas verse. Sûdadohas verily is breath. He joins the world of the sky with breath.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 5. He recites the eighty tristichs of Ush n ih. Verily, the eighty Ush n ih tristichs are that world, the heaven. Whatever there is in that world of glory, greatness, wives, food, and honour, also the divine being of the Devas (Brahman), may I obtain it, may I win it, may it be mine.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 6. Next comes the Sûdadohas verse. Sûdadohas verily is the breath. He joins that world with breath, yea, with breath.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 192:2 These and the following verses form the food of the bird. Comm. The verses themselves are given by S aunaka in the fifth Âra n yaka.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
